briefdescription.para: Number of crew members in the vessel.
Number of crew members in the vessel. (Returned as a float)
Number of parts in the vessel.
List of the parts in the vessel.
Checks whether there are any crew members in the VesselCrewManifest in a certain state.

parameterdescription.para: State to check for.
If false, returns true when any crew member is in that state. If true, returns true when any crew member is not in that state.

simplesect.para: Returns true if there are any crew members in the VesselCrewManifest in that state, false if there are none. Does the opposite if notInState is set to true.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether there are any crew members in the VesselCrewManifest in a certain state.

parameterdescription.para: State to check for.
Roster to get the crew member information from.
If false, returns true when any crew member is in that state. If true, returns true when any crew member is not in that state.

simplesect.para: Returns true if there are any crew members in the VesselCrewManifest in that state, false if there are none. Does the opposite if notInState is set to true.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether there are any crew members in the VesselCrewManifest with a certain trait.

parameterdescription.para: Trait to check for.
If false, returns true when any crew member has that trait. If true, returns true when any crew member doesn't have that trait.

simplesect.para: Returns true if there are any crew members in the VesselCrewManifest have that trait, false if there are none. Does the opposite if noCrewWithTrait is set to true.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether there are any crew members in the VesselCrewManifest with a certain trait.

parameterdescription.para: Trait to check for.
Roster to get the crew member information from.
If false, returns true when any crew member has that trait. If true, returns true when any crew member doesn't have that trait.

simplesect.para: Returns true if there are any crew members in the VesselCrewManifest have that trait, false if there are none. Does the opposite if noCrewWithTrait is set to true.

briefdescription.para: Assigns the crew in this VesselCrewManifest to the ship.

parameterdescription.para: Ship to assign the crew to.

briefdescription.para: Assigns the crew in this VesselCrewManifest to the ship.

parameterdescription.para: Ship to assign the crew to.
Roster to get the crew member information from.

briefdescription.para: Check whether the VesselCrewManifest contains a crew member.

parameterdescription.para: Crew member to search for.

simplesect.para: Returns true if crew member is in the VesselCrewManifest, false if the crew member isn't.

briefdescription.para: Print out information concerning all the seats (and their occupants) in this VesselCrewManifest.
Filters this vessel manifest excluding parts that don't meet the given criteria.

parameterdescription.para: Filter to apply to the parts.

briefdescription.para: Get a list of all of the crew in the VesselCrewManifest.

parameterdescription.para: VesselCrewManifest to be cloned

simplesect.para: Returns a list of all of the crew in the VesselCrewManifest.

briefdescription.para: Get a list of all of the crew in the VesselCrewManifest.

parameterdescription.para: VesselCrewManifest to be cloned
Roster to use to get the kerbal information.

simplesect.para: Returns a list of all of the crew in the VesselCrewManifest.

briefdescription.para: Get a list of the parts which can be crewed.

simplesect.para: Returns a list of the parts which can be crewed.

briefdescription.para: Get the Crew Inventory Costs. If roster is not supplied will use HighLogic.CurrentGame.CrewRoster.

parameterdescription.para: The KerbalRoster to use, if you don't want to use HighLogic.CurrentGame.CrewRoster

briefdescription.para: Get the Crew Inventory Mass. Will use HighLogic.CurrentGame.CrewRoster.
Get the Crew Inventory Mass. If roster is not supplied will use HighLogic.CurrentGame.CrewRoster.

parameterdescription.para: Set to Null for HighLogic.CurrentGame.CrewRoster. Otherwise set to the KerbalRoster to use

briefdescription.para: Get the Crew Resource Mass. Will use HighLogic.CurrentGame.CrewRoster.
Get the Crew Resource Mass. If roster is not supplied will use HighLogic.CurrentGame.CrewRoster.

parameterdescription.para: Set to Null for HighLogic.CurrentGame.CrewRoster. Otherwise set to the KerbalRoster to use

briefdescription.para: Gets the PartCrewManifest with the specified id

parameterdescription.para: id to search for.

simplesect.para: Returns the PartCrewManifest with the specified id.

briefdescription.para: Gets the PartCrewManifest in which the crew member is seated.

parameterdescription.para: Crew member to search for.

simplesect.para: Returns the PartCrewManifest in which the crew member is seated.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether there are any crew members in the VesselCrewManifest.

simplesect.para: Returns true if there are any crew members in the VesselCrewManifest, false if there are none.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether there are any crew members in the VesselCrewManifest.

parameterdescription.para: Roster to get the crew member information from.

simplesect.para: Returns true if there are any crew members in the VesselCrewManifest, false if there are none.

briefdescription.para: Removes a crew member from the previously assigned part and this crew manifest.

parameterdescription.para: Crew member to be removed.

briefdescription.para: Removes the part and the crew assigned to it from this VesselCrewManifest.

parameterdescription.para: Part to be removed.

briefdescription.para: Removes a crew member from its previously assigned part and assigns it to the new part.

parameterdescription.para: Crew member to set.
Part to assign the crew member to.

briefdescription.para: Adds a PartCrewManifest with the specified id. Removes the crew from the previous part if there was one using the specified id, then removes the part. Checks whether the crew in the new part are assigned to a previously used part and removes them from that previously used part if they are.

parameterdescription.para: ID to assign the new part.
PartCrewManifest to add.

briefdescription.para: Adds a PartCrewManifest with the specified id. Removes the crew from the previous part if there was one using the specified id, then removes the part. Checks whether the crew in the new part are assigned to a previously used part and removes them from the new part if they are.

parameterdescription.para: ID to assign the new part.
PartCrewManifest to add.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new VesselCrewManifest from vesselNode. Then assigns the crew members from this VesselCrewManifest to the new VesselCrewManifest if they pass the persistFilter.

parameterdescription.para: ConfigNode to create the new VesselCrewManifest from.
Filter to apply to crew members. If they pass it, they get on the new VesselCrewManifest.

simplesect.para: Returns a new VesselCrewManifest with all the crew members who have passed the persistFilter.

briefdescription.para: Updates a PartCrewManifest with the specified id to have the crew members in the referencePCM. Removes the crew in the referencePCM from the previous assigned part if there was one. Then assigns the crew in the referencePCM to the part with the specified id.

parameterdescription.para: Crew member to search for.
Crew member to search for.

briefdescription.para: Base constructor.
Clone a vessel crew manifest.

parameterdescription.para: VesselCrewManifest to be cloned
If false, crew members from the original VesselCrewManifest will be seated in the clone. If true, there will be no crew members in the clone.

simplesect.para: Returns a new VesselCrewManifest which is a clone of the original.

briefdescription.para: Generate a vessel crew manifest based on a craft node.

parameterdescription.para: Vessel to be populated

simplesect.para: Returns a new VesselCrewManifest based on a craft node.

memberdef.argsstring: (VesselCrewManifest m1, VesselCrewManifest m2, Func< PartCrewManifest, bool > inclusionFilter=null)
memberdef.name: MergeInto

briefdescription.para: Merge m2 into m1 and discard anything failing the the inclusion filter. If an entry is contained in both, the one from m1 is kept. If a crewmember is present in more than one part, it will be removed from any parts after the first ocurrence.

Adds a list of crew members to the vessel crew manifest. If an invalid seat assignment is found, the Kerbal is set to Available and the vesselCrew list is updated to remove them. This method can only be used if Making History Expansion is installed.

parameterdescription.para: List of new crew members.
Kerbal roster to use to get detailed information about the crew members.

briefdescription.para: Class which represents the parts in a vessel and the crew members which are assigned to them.
